limit_reached: Assessment is complete! No more images to view.
unprocessed_error: The error wasn't processed, you might have navigated to the wrong page.
abnormal_stats: Statistics on assessment anomalies among all assessors
config_structure_error: Config file must be a set of strings

config_props.assessment_limit: User limit on the number of scores (0 - unlimited)
config_props.cliImport_json_path: Path to the JSON file with model scores by default

slider_creation_error: Couldn't create the slider: the user doesn't have any scores in tasks
slider_opening_error: The user doesn't have any sliders to open
taskset_limit_error: You cannot set the limit that is lower than the current maximum value for user scores (current value - %s)
disabled_dataset_reason: You cannot change the dataset's status because users have already assessed some of its data.
markup_page_description: On this page you can see the statistics on the number of checks by the user, which helps you track the task progress and all work done by assessors. Images marked as broken are counted as viewed.
anomalies_page_description: On this page you can see the score anomalies among all users in total. If the assessor score differs from the average score of this image calculated for all assessors not less than the permissible variation value, this score is considered an anomaly. The number of such anomalies is the metric for measuring the assessor's performance. This metric characterizes the number of "errors" or how much the opinion of this assessor differs in comparison to that of teammates. The permissible variation is set by the data scientist based on the knowledge of the task and assessors.
local_anomalies_page_description: On this page you can see the score anomalies among all users in total. If the assessor score differs from the average score of this image calculated for a specific assessor not less than the permissible variation value, this score is considered an anomaly. The number of such anomalies is the metric for measuring the assessor's performance. This metric characterizes the number of "errors" or changes of the assessor's opinion. The permissible variation is set by the data scientist based on the knowledge of the task and assessors. There's no reason to review individual anomalies if each image is shown only once.
slider_creation_modal_title: Create a slider for the task
